author: Galactic2187
title: Cool shrine, AWSOME card
review:
I got this set manly to get the Sensi Wu card.

Box/Instructions

It came in a somewhat larger polybag than normal. The instructions are easy to follow.

Parts

Not much to say about bricks, but the card.......AWSOME! The card is in 3D, when you move it Sensi Wu's walking stick moves.

Minifigures

None.

The build

Well I built this set in my car (wile my dad drove) but overall the build took about 15 minutes. The build was quite enjoyable.

The completed model

When I built it, it was a lot bigger than I though.

Summary

author: vikings
title: Ninjago Card Shrine
review:
Box/Instructions: 

This set comes in a slightly larger polybag with a small instruction booklet. 

Parts:

You get a few nice parts in this set. You get two three leaf plants, a brown staff, and a red 2x2 rounded plate. The red and black pieces (while common) look and work well together. The card you get is of Sensei Wu. It is a 3-D card and certain parts of it pop out looking really cool. The total piece count for the set is 98. 

The Build:

The build was quick and easy. It took me around 5 minutes to build. 

Overall Opinion:

Overall this is a nice Card Shrine. The build is simple and easy. It really has that Shrine/Japanese look to it. The white dish with the 2x2 rounded red plate really look good as well as the two lanterns on either side of it. The two three leaf plants with the brown staff add to the base of the shrine as well. The red and black colors while simple work great with this set. I recommend this set to any Ninjago fan/collector. If you aren't a fan of Ninjago then this set probably isn't for you. If you do get it will look very nice with anyones collection. Overall I'm giving it a 5-star rating.
